result.value: Source code for a January 1978 version of Zork
January 1978 version of Zork, an interactive fiction game created at MIT by Tim Anderson, Marc Blank, Bruce Daniels, and Dave Lebling.

This repository contains the source code for a January 1978 version of [Zork](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zork), an interactive fiction game created at MIT by Tim Anderson, Marc Blank, Bruce Daniels, and Dave Lebling. The files are a part of the [Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Tapes of Tech Square (ToTS) collection](https://archivesspace.mit.edu/repositories/2/resources/1265) at the MIT Libraries Department of Distinctive Collections (DDC).

The [```ar1.random```](../main/zork/```ar1.random```) directory contains the extracted files from the ```ar1.random``` file within the [BASH5*](../main/zork/taa) directory. The [BASH6*](../main/zork/ar1.random/dungon.11) and [BASH7*](../main/zork/ar1.random/zork.3) files are the source code to the [BASH8*](../main/zork/sys2/ts.zork) file. The files were extracted recently and added to this directory by DDC digital archivist, Joe Carrano, for researcher ease of access. 
The [```lcf```](../main/zork/lcf) and [BASH10*](../main/zork/madman) directories contain the source code for the game. 
The files outside of these subdirectories, such as [```act1.71```](../main/zork/act1.71), etc., are the decrypted versions of files found in the [BASH9*](../main/zork/lcf) directory. The decrypted versions were created recently and added to this directory by DDC digital archivist, Joe Carrano, for researcher ease of access.
This file is metadata about the Zork files, using the [CodeMeta Project](https://codemeta.github.io/) schema.
This file is the readme detailing the content and context for this repository.
